alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 8:13PM EDT until September 30 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM EDT, Doppler radar is still showing heavy tropical showers redeveloping around the region and it is possible that a few locations will approach 3 inches of rainfall. Heavy rain had fallen across much of the county and streams remain elevated in most areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincolnton, Maiden, Westport, Belwood, High Shoals, Boger City, Iron Station, Denver, Lake Norman, Lowesville, Crouse and Vale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
